limp.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: His body suddenly went limp and he fell down on the floor.
limp.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to walk slowly and with difficulty because one leg is hurt or injured
limp.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Moreno limped off the field with a foot injury.
limp.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a ship or aircraft limps somewhere, it goes there slowly, because it has been damaged
limp.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The damaged liner limped into New York.
limp.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the way someone walks when they are limping
limp.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Young walked with a slight limp.
